zeusMyths.title: Battle with the Titans
zeusMyths.description: A myth about how Zeus led the Olympians in a battle against the Titans to establish his rule.
zeusMyths.content: After the Titans seized power, Zeus gathered his brothers and sisters to start a war. It was a long and brutal battle, in which Zeus and the Olympians emerged victorious.

zeusMyths.title: Abduction of Europa
zeusMyths.description: The story of how Zeus, transformed into a bull, abducted Europa.
zeusMyths.content: Zeus, captivated by Europa’s beauty, took the form of a white bull to approach her. He then carried her off to Crete, where she became the mother of his sons.

zeusMyths.title: Birth of Athena
zeusMyths.description: The myth about how Athena was born from Zeus's head in full armor.
zeusMyths.content: When Zeus heard the prophecy that his child with Metis would be very powerful, he swallowed her to avoid the threat. Soon after, he suffered a terrible headache, and Athena sprang from his head, fully armored.

zeusMyths.title: Creation of Pandora
zeusMyths.description: The story of how Zeus punished humanity by creating the first woman—Pandora.
zeusMyths.content: To punish humans for the gift of fire that Prometheus had stolen, Zeus ordered the creation of Pandora. She brought with her a vessel of misfortunes, and when it was opened, it released all evils upon humanity.

zeusMyths.title: Punishment of Prometheus
zeusMyths.description: The myth about how Zeus punished Prometheus for stealing fire for humans.
zeusMyths.content: Angry at Prometheus for stealing fire and giving it to humans, Zeus chained him to a rock, where an eagle devoured his liver each day, only for it to regenerate every night.

zeusMyths.title: Zeus and Leda
zeusMyths.description: The story of how Zeus, in the form of a swan, charmed Leda.
zeusMyths.content: Zeus, enchanted by the beautiful Leda, took the form of a swan to win her favor. As a result of their union, their children were born, including Helen of Troy and the twins Castor and Pollux.
